body: @iadfy recommend you run lineprofiler to find the slow areas and then respond. COCO test.py runs on 5000 images in about 2 minutes on a P100, so unless its reproducible in COCO or you specify profiler results I can't help you.

@iadfy another option is to modify your NMS style in `non_maximum_suppression()` in utils.py. You can try swapping between `OR` and `MERGE` methods. `MERGE` returns slightly higher mAP at the expense of higher computation time. You may need to git clone the latest repo in order to do this, as there have been many recent changes in this area of the code:

https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/324dc6af6e795135ea4e0f32ffb080ca91913977/utils/utils.py#L380-L419
It took about 20 seconds to compute the mAP of 4 pictures. Why is it so slow？

@iadfy @pprp: On a P100 instance on GCP, `test.py` computes mAP at about 0.45s per 32-image batch:

```
ultralytics@instance-1:~/yolov3$ python3 test.py
Namespace(batch_size=32, cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', conf_thres=0.3, data_cfg='cfg/coco.data', img_size=416, iou_thres=0.5, nms_thres=0.45, save_json=False, weights='weights/yolov3.weights')

Using cuda _CudaDeviceProperties(name='Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB', major=6, minor=0, total_memory=16280MB, multi_processor_count=56)

      Image      Total          P          R        mAP
         32       5000      0.635      0.581       0.57      0.551s
         64       5000       0.63      0.591      0.578       0.43s
         96       5000      0.659      0.629      0.619      0.453s
        128       5000      0.657       0.63      0.621      0.434s
        160       5000      0.663      0.639      0.631      0.442s
        192       5000      0.659      0.635      0.629      0.444s
        224       5000      0.648      0.624      0.618      0.452s
        256       5000       0.65       0.62      0.615      0.441s
...
```

my line_profiler on non_max_suppression is on below. i don't know where to see. could you help?

--------------------------------------------------------
      Image      Total          P          R        mAP
Timer unit: 3.09179e-07 s

Total time: 92.4133 s
File: D:\CS\yolov3\utils\utils.py
Function: non_max_suppression at line 287

Line #      Hits         Time  Per Hit   % Time  Line Contents
==============================================================
   287                                           def non_max_suppression(prediction, conf_thres=0.5, nms_thres=0.4):
   288                                               """

   290                                               Non-Maximum Suppression to further filter detections.
   291                                               Returns detections with shape:
   292                                                   (x1, y1, x2, y2, object_conf, class_score, class_pred)
   293                                               """
   294
   295         1         50.0     50.0      0.0      output = [None for _ in range(len(prediction))]
   296         7        707.0    101.0      0.0      for image_i, pred in enumerate(prediction):
   297                                                   # Filter out confidence scores below threshold
   298                                                   # Get score and class with highest confidence
   299
   300                                                   # cross-class NMS (experimental)
   301         6         60.0     10.0      0.0          cross_class_nms = False
   302         6         17.0      2.8      0.0          if cross_class_nms:
   303                                                       a = pred.clone()

   305                                                       a = a[indices]

   308                                                           if i >= len(a) - 1:

) < radius)

   313

   315                                                               close = close + i + 1

)
   317                                                               bad = close[iou > nms_thres]
   318
   319                                                               if len(bad) > 0:
   320                                                                   mask = torch.ones(len(a)).type(torch.ByteTensor)
   321                                                                   mask[bad] = 0
   322                                                                   a = a[mask]
   323                                                       pred = a
   324

   326                                                   # x, y, w, h = pred[:, 0], pred[:, 1], pred[:, 2], pred[:, 3]
   327                                                   # a = w * h  # area
   328                                                   # ar = w / (h + 1e-16)  # aspect ratio
   329                                                   # n = len(w)
   330                                                   # log_w, log_h, log_a, log_ar = torch.log(w), torch.log(h), torch.log(a), torch.log(ar)
   331                                                   # shape_likelihood = np.zeros((n, 60), dtype=np.float32)

   337
   338         6       4742.0    790.3      0.0          class_prob, class_pred = torch.max(F.softmax(pred[:, 5:], 1), 1)
   339
   340         6       3035.0    505.8      0.0          v = ((pred[:, 4] > conf_thres) & (class_prob > .4))  # TODO examine arbitrary 0.4 thres here
   341         6       4364.0    727.3      0.0          v = v.nonzero().squeeze()
   342         6        106.0     17.7      0.0          if len(v.shape) == 0:
   343                                                       v = v.unsqueeze(0)
   344
   345         6       1884.0    314.0      0.0          pred = pred[v]

   348

   356

ze(1)), 1)
   359                                                   # Iterate through all predicted classes
   360         6      16816.0   2802.7      0.0          unique_labels = detections[:, -1].cpu().unique()
   361         6         38.0      6.3      0.0          if prediction.is_cuda:
   362         6       2088.0    348.0      0.0              unique_labels = unique_labels.cuda(prediction.device)
   363
   364         6         23.0      3.8      0.0          nms_style = 'MERGE'  # 'OR' (default), 'AND', 'MERGE' (experimental)
   365        18       1542.0     85.7      0.0          for c in unique_labels:
   366                                                       # Get the detections with class c
   367        12      14759.0   1229.9      0.0              dc = detections[detections[:, -1] == c]
   368                                                       # Sort the detections by maximum object confidence
   369        12      27957.0   2329.8      0.0              _, conf_sort_index = torch.sort(dc[:, 4] * dc[:, 5], descending=True)
   370        12       3313.0    276.1      0.0              dc = dc[conf_sort_index]
   371

   373        12         81.0      6.8      0.0              det_max = []

   375                                                           while dc.shape[0]:

   377                                                               if len(dc) == 1:  # Stop if we're at the last detection
   378                                                                   break

   380                                                               dc = dc[1:][iou < nms_thres]  # remove ious > threshold
   381
   382                                                           # Image      Total          P          R        mAP

   384
   385        12         37.0      3.1      0.0              elif nms_style == 'AND':  # requires overlap, single boxes erased
   386                                                           while len(dc) > 1:
   387                                                               iou = bbox_iou(dc[:1], dc[1:])  # iou with other boxes
   388                                                               if iou.max() > 0.5:
   389                                                                   det_max.append(dc[:1])
   390                                                               dc = dc[1:][iou < nms_thres]  # remove ious > threshold
   391
   392        12         35.0      2.9      0.0              elif nms_style == 'MERGE':  # weighted mixture box
   393     37474     777619.0     20.8      0.3                  while len(dc) > 0:
   394     37462  133808018.0   3571.8     44.8                      iou = bbox_iou(dc[:1], dc[0:])  # iou with other boxes
   395     37462    5326260.0    142.2      1.8                      i = iou > nms_thres
   396
   397     37462   62382452.0   1665.2     20.9                      weights = dc[i, 4:5] * dc[i, 5:6]
   398     37462   61213291.0   1634.0     20.5                      dc[0, :4] = (weights * dc[i, :4]).sum(0) / weights.sum()
   399     37462    2288985.0     61.1      0.8                      det_max.append(dc[:1])
   400     37462   32763676.0    874.6     11.0                      dc = dc[iou < nms_thres]
   401
   402                                                           # Image      Total          P          R        mAP
   403                                                           #  4964       5000      0.633      0.598      0.589  # normal
   404
   405        12         53.0      4.4      0.0              if len(det_max) > 0:
   406        12     212907.0  17742.2      0.1                  det_max = torch.cat(det_max)
   407                                                           # Add max detections to outputs
   408        12       3952.0    329.3      0.0                  output[image_i] = det_max if output[image_i] is None else torch.cat((output[image_i], det_max))
   409
   410         1         50.0     50.0      0.0      return output

I found something interesting.
what I was using is customized .cfg file which has classes=2, filters=21 that derived from (2 classes +4+1 ) *3 =21 and each testing tooks about 99.3 sec for test.py (non_max_suppression exactly).
-----------------------------------------------------------
    Image      Total          P          R        mAP       time
          6        202   0.000239      0.417    0.00304       99.3
------------------------------------------------------------------
however, with yolov3.cfg, which has 80 classes and 255 filters, testing (after training 1 epoch with same dataset as i used for 2 classes and 21 filters) tooks around 0.15 sec!
----------------------------------------------------------------------
  Image      Total          P          R        mAP       time
          4        202          0          0          0      0.229
          8        202          0          0          0      0.109
         12        202          0          0          0       0.14
         16        202          0          0          0      0.151
         20        202          0          0          0      0.157
------------------------------------------------------------------
it seems that smaller number of classes with smaller filters takes longer time to testing but i have no idea where to figure out... any idea would be helpful.

thanks in advance

issue.title: Explaination on Why NMS Is Slow During Custom Dataset Training And How to Solve it

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
In issue #112 , @iadfy says that NMS is slow when training a yolov3 network with just two classes. This happen to me too. It takes 2 seconds to forward and backward a batch but 99 seconds to NMS the same batch. @iadfy says that _it seems that smaller number of classes with smaller filters takes longer time to testing but i have no idea where to figure out... any idea would be helpful._ Smaller filters takes longer time is just a result, not the cause.

The real cause is NMS is a slow algorithm with time complexity of O(N^2). When you training a new network, the weights are just random initialized. The output of YOLOLayer is just random number centered at 0.5. NMS threshold for testing during training is 0.3, so thousands of bounding box candidates needs for NMS, depend on your input image size and configuration of YOLOLayer Input. And what's worse, the candidates IOU is small with a large probability due to randomization, so the cancellation of high IOU boxes won't work. All these lead to wasting O(N^2) time on NMS on meaningless random box candidates.

How to solve it? Well you can just skip testing of few epoch on the begining. Here's the code:

```python
# Calculate mAP
with torch.no_grad():
    if(epoch > 40):
        mAP, R, P = test.test(cfg, data_cfg, weights=latest, batch_size=batch_size, img_size=img_size)

# Write epoch results
if(epoch > 40):
    with open('results.txt', 'a') as file:
        file.write(s + '%11.3g' * 3 % (mAP, P, R) + '\n')
```
On train.py, line 169 to 178.

Good Luck.

body:
@iadfy @pprp It occured to me that the SGD burn-in functionality might be causing this, since it is hard-coded for a slow LR ramp during the first epoch, from lr=0.0 to lr=0.001 over the first 1000 batches (like darknet). If custom datasets have <1000 batches their parameters may not update substantially by the time NMS needs to be run during testing the epoch 0 results. I've added code to dynamically adapt the burn-in length now to a max of 1/5 of the number of batches in the first epoch.
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/6fb14fc903fcea68239541a3de0fca5e6dc036e7/train.py#L90

I've also switched the default NMS method from MERGE (slightly more accurate, but possibly slightly slower), to OR, the default method used by darknet.
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/6fb14fc903fcea68239541a3de0fca5e6dc036e7/utils/utils.py#L382

Hopefully these changes help alleviate the NMS speed issue on custom datasets.
